meanings.definition: The belief that only oneself exists or can be known to exist.
meanings.sent1: Some people find comfort in solipsisms, thinking they are the only real beings.
meanings.sent2: His constant solipsisms made it hard for him to connect with others.
meanings.sent3: The solipsisms of the cat led it to believe it was the only creature in the house.
meanings.sent4: Her solipsisms created a barrier between her and the rest of the world.
meanings.sent5: The philosopher's solipsisms were so extreme, he doubted the existence of everything else.

meanings.definition: A theory that the self is the only thing that can be known to exist.
meanings.sent1: The solipsisms of the philosopher led to his isolation from society.
meanings.sent2: She was intrigued by the concept of solipsisms and its implications.
meanings.sent3: The student's solipsisms made it difficult for him to accept differing viewpoints.
meanings.sent4: In his solipsisms, he believed he was the center of the universe.
meanings.sent5: The solipsisms of the scientist challenged the very nature of reality.
